title: About
text: About this site

title: Ananya Uppal
text:
I’m a second-year graduate student pursuing a Master’s in Computer and Information Technology at Purdue University, West Lafayette.
I am a member of the Responsible Data Science (RDS) Lab, where my thesis work focuses on Explainable AI with Dr. Romila Pradhan. I have also been working as a Graduate TA for the last 3 semsters: CNIT 323: Basic Cyberforensics, CNIT 392: Enterprise Data Management and CNIT 175: Intoduction to Visual Programming.
Over the summer of 2025, I did an internship at Leen, as a Data Science Intern, where I worked on building integrations for security platforms. I previously worked as a Software Engineer at Palo Alto Networks in Bengaluru for a year in the Next Generation Firewall team, working on automation of testing workflows and adding API’s to interact with the Panorama and Firewall devices. I have also completed two other internships: one at Nasdaq, in the Enterprise Blockchain team and the other at Palo Alto Networks in the same team, before I joined as a full-time employee.
I am a classically trained Hindustani Classical vocalist, and I was in a band called Tin Pan Alley in my undergrad. I also love watching movies and travelling.
On this site I keep a list of my publications, projects, and my resume, as well as a technical blog.



Purdue University, West Lafayette, Indiana | 4.0/4.0
Master of Science in Computer and Information Technology
Coursework: Responsible Data Science, IT Data Analytics, Human-computer Interaction, Research Methods and Artificial Intelligence.
PES University, Bangalore, India | 9.06/10
Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science and Engineering
6-time awardee of the MRD Scholarship (40% tuition waiver offered to top 20% students)

title: Ananya Uppal
text:
Featured Projects




E-Commerce Platform


A full-stack e-commerce solution built with React, Node.js, and Stripe integration. Features include user authentication, product management, and order processing.
Tech Stack: React, Node.js, MongoDB, Stripe API

Data Visualization Dashboard


Interactive dashboard for analyzing sales data with real-time updates. Built with D3.js and React, featuring responsive charts and filtering capabilities.
Tech Stack: React, D3.js, Python, Flask, PostgreSQL

title: Ananya Uppal
text:
I’m a graduate student pursuing my Master’s in Computer and Information Technology at Purdue University, pursuing my thesis in Responsible AI. Currently, I’m a member of the RDS Lab working on Explainable AI research with Dr. Romila Pradhan, while serving as a Graduate TA for Enterprise Data Management.
I worked as a Software Engineer at Palo Alto Networks in Bengaluru for ~1 year in the Next Generation Firewall team. I have also completed two internships at Nasdaq, one in the Enterprise Blockchain team and the other at Palo Alto Networks.
By training I’m a computer scientist specializing in machine learning, data science, and cybersecurity; professionally, I’ve worked as a software engineer, automation tester, and blockchain analyst.
On this site I keep a list of publications, projects, and my resume, as well as a technical blog.

title: Ananya Uppal
text:
Tweet Sentiment Analysis using Spark Streaming with Hadoop
Conducted sentiment analysis on streaming tweets using Spark Streaming and PySpark. Trained multiple models (Logistic Regression, Naive Bayes, SVM) for sentiment classification. Implemented K-means clustering and optimized model performance through hyperparameter tuning.
Automated Testing Framework for Network Security Devices | Palo Alto Networks
Developed comprehensive automated functional testing workflows using Jenkins for VM and hardware-based Panorama and Firewall devices. Boosted automated test suite to ensure critical certificate values are updated across 8 OS releases and 12 million devices.
Enterprise Blockchain Performance Analysis | Nasdaq
Conducted performance-based analysis of enterprise blockchains including VMware Blockchain, Hyperledger Fabric, Hyperledger Besu, and R3 Corda for proprietary use cases, utilizing Hyperledger Caliper for comprehensive evaluation across 17+ criteria.

title: Ananya Uppal
text:
An Interpretable Hybrid Recommender Based on Graph Convolution to Address Serendipity | Published at CCCE’23 - Presented at Stockholm, Sweden in March 2023
Introduced a 4-model hybrid model utilising graph convolutional networks to augment recommendation serendipity. Formulated a novel distance-based serendipity metric and improved interpretability through KNN feature importance analysis.
RePI: Research Paper Impact Analysis | Published at ISDA’22 - Presented in December 2022
Created a web application in Python (Streamlit) to analyze the impact of research papers using Semantic Scholar API using DOI. Formulated a unique impact factor ratio to quantify publication influence.

title: Ananya Uppal
text:
RDS Lab, Purdue University | Aug 2024 - Present
Working on Explainable AI research under Dr. Romila Pradhan, focusing on:

Developing interpretable machine learning models
Investigating fairness and bias in AI systems
Creating tools for AI transparency and accountability

title: Ananya Uppal
text:
Conference Publications

An Interpretable Hybrid Recommender Based on Graph Convolution to Address Serendipity
Published at CCCE’23 | Presented at Stockholm, Sweden in March 2023

This research introduces a novel approach to recommendation systems by combining graph convolutional networks with traditional recommendation methods to enhance serendipity in recommendations. Key contributions include:

Developed a 4-model hybrid architecture integrating graph convolutional networks
Formulated a new distance-based metric for measuring recommendation serendipity
Enhanced interpretability through KNN feature importance analysis
Demonstrated improved recommendation diversity while maintaining accuracy

View Publication View Slides



RePI: Research Paper Impact Analysis
Published at ISDA’22 | Presented in December 2022

Developed a comprehensive web application for analyzing research paper impact using advanced metrics and visualization techniques. Project highlights:

Created an intuitive web interface using Python and Streamlit
Integrated with Semantic Scholar API for comprehensive paper analysis
Developed a novel impact factor ratio for publication influence measurement
Implemented interactive visualizations for impact metrics

View Publication View Demo

text:
Leen | July 2025 - August 2025

Designed connectors for API-based data models to map and consolidate GRC entity, evidence, assessment, and controls data from ServiceNow GRC, OneTrust, and Archer.
Interacted directly with customers to introduce new data fields for connector integrations in a startup environment.





Palo Alto Networks | August 2023 - August 2024

Developed comprehensive automated functional testing workflows using Jenkins for VM and hardware-based Panorama and Firewall devices.
Boosted automated test suite to ensure critical certificate values are updated across 8 OS releases and 12 million devices.





Palo Alto Networks | January 2023 - August 2023

Reduced automation backlog by 30%, ensuring test case integration into regression suites using pytest and gnmic.
Expanded REST APIs in six or more PanOS releases to facilitate interaction with the PanOS UI using Selenium for streaming telemetry





Nasdaq | June 2022 - July 2022

Conducted performance-based analysis of enterprise blockchains including VMware Blockchain, Hyperledger Fabric, Hyperledger Besu, and R3 Corda for proprietary use cases
Utilized Hyperledger Caliper for comprehensive evaluation across 17+ criteria
Analyzed blockchain performance metrics and provided recommendations for optimization.

title: Ananya Uppal
text:
Selected Projects

Time Sensitive Chemical Identification Tool
Dow, The Data Mine | Spring 2025

Developed a tool to predict peroxide forming proclivity of chemicals using a multi-stage machine learning pipeline
Collected and preprocessed data from 300+ chemicals
Trained a multi-stage XGBoost model for accurate predictions
Deployed the solution as a web application using R Shiny for user-friendly interface

Trained multiple machine learning models (Logistic Regression, Naive Bayes, SVM) for sentiment classification
Implemented K-means clustering for data segmentation
Optimized model performance through hyperparameter tuning and cross-validation

title: Exploring Explainable AI: Making Machine Learning Models More Transparent
text: As AI systems become increasingly complex and widespread, the need for explainability and interpretability has never been more crucial. In this post, I’ll share insights from my research in Explainable AI (XAI) at Purdue University’s RDS Lab.

title: Exploring Explainable AI: Making Machine Learning Models More Transparent
text: As AI systems become increasingly complex and widespread, the need for explainability and interpretability has never been more crucial. In this post, I’ll share insights from my research in Explainable AI (XAI) at Purdue University’s RDS Lab.

title: Exploring Explainable AI: Making Machine Learning Models More Transparent
text:
Why Explainable AI Matters
Machine learning models, especially deep neural networks, often operate as “black boxes.” While they can achieve impressive performance, understanding their decision-making process remains challenging. This lack of transparency can be problematic in:

Healthcare decisions
Financial services
Legal systems
Security applications

title: Exploring Explainable AI: Making Machine Learning Models More Transparent
text:
Current Research Directions

1. Feature Attribution Methods
One approach to explaining model decisions is understanding which input features contributed most to the output:
# Example using SHAP values
import shap
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)


2. Interpretable Architectures
Some research focuses on developing inherently interpretable models:

Decision trees
Rule-based systems
Attention mechanisms in neural networks

title: Exploring Explainable AI: Making Machine Learning Models More Transparent
text:
Challenges and Future Work
The field of XAI faces several challenges:

Balancing accuracy with interpretability
Developing standardized evaluation metrics
Making explanations useful for non-technical users

title: Exploring Explainable AI: Making Machine Learning Models More Transparent
text:
Conclusion
As we continue our research at the RDS Lab, we’re working on novel approaches to make AI systems more transparent and trustworthy. Stay tuned for more updates on our progress!

title: Exploring Explainable AI: Making Machine Learning Models More Transparent
text:
References

Molnar, C. (2022). Interpretable Machine Learning
Ribeiro, M. T., et al. (2016). “Why Should I Trust You?: Explaining the Predictions of Any Classifier”







Note



This is part of my ongoing research at Purdue University. For more information, check out my publications.

title: Comparing Enterprise Blockchain Platforms: Insights from Industry
text: During my internship at Nasdaq’s Enterprise Blockchain team, I had the opportunity to evaluate various blockchain platforms for enterprise use cases. This post shares insights from that experience, focusing on performance analysis and practical implementation considerations.

title: Comparing Enterprise Blockchain Platforms: Insights from Industry
text: During my internship at Nasdaq’s Enterprise Blockchain team, I had the opportunity to evaluate various blockchain platforms for enterprise use cases. This post shares insights from that experience, focusing on performance analysis and practical implementation considerations.

title: Comparing Enterprise Blockchain Platforms: Insights from Industry
text:
Enterprise Blockchain Platforms

Hyperledger Fabric

Modular architecture
Permissioned network
Flexible consensus mechanisms
Strong privacy controls



R3 Corda

Built for financial institutions
Direct transaction between parties
No global data distribution
JVM-based smart contracts



VMware Blockchain

Enterprise-grade infrastructure
Built-in high availability
Scalable architecture
Advanced monitoring capabilities

title: Comparing Enterprise Blockchain Platforms: Insights from Industry
Comparing Enterprise Blockchain Platforms: Insights from Industry
text:
Key Findings

Transaction Processing

Hyperledger Fabric: 3000+ TPS
R3 Corda: 1500+ TPS
VMware Blockchain: 2500+ TPS

Deployment Complexity

Setup time
Maintenance requirements
Learning curve

title: Comparing Enterprise Blockchain Platforms: Insights from Industry
text:
Best Practices
Based on our analysis, here are some recommendations for enterprise blockchain implementation:

Start with clear use case requirements
Consider scalability needs early
Plan for integration with existing systems
Invest in proper monitoring tools
Build with security in mind

title: Comparing Enterprise Blockchain Platforms: Insights from Industry
text:
Conclusion
Enterprise blockchain platforms have evolved significantly, each offering unique advantages. The choice of platform should be driven by specific use case requirements, existing infrastructure, and team expertise.






Tip



Want to learn more about enterprise blockchain? Check out my project experience at Nasdaq.
